intro: Vincetoxicum microphyllum, commonly known as small-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, ranging in color from white to pale pink. Vincetoxicum microphyllum is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
